particlesim
Interface ICalculate

All Known Implementing Classes:
CalculateCharged
public interface ICalculate

Interface for calculating particle characteristic values, and for calculating particle movements based on these values.

Method Summary
 IParticle[] CalculateIteration(IParticle[] Particles)
          Calculates instantaneous particle movements based on particle characteristics.
 IParticle[] InitializeParticles(int NumParticles, int MaxX, int MaxY, int MaxZ)
          Call this method to initialize your particles.
 IParticle[] MoveParticles(IParticle[] Particles)
          Adjusts the particles' axis values based on existing values.
 

Method Detail

CalculateIteration

IParticle[] CalculateIteration(IParticle[] Particles)
Calculates instantaneous particle movements based on particle characteristics.

Parameters:
Particles - The collection of particles to perform calculations on.
Returns:

InitializeParticles

IParticle[] InitializeParticles(int NumParticles,
                                int MaxX,
                                int MaxY,
                                int MaxZ)
Call this method to initialize your particles. This involves the creation of the number of particles indicated in the NumParticles parameter.

Parameters:
NumParticles - The number of particle to create.
MaxX - The X boundary of the particles' container.
MaxY - The Y boundary of the particles' container.
MaxZ - The Z boundary of the particles' container.
Returns:

MoveParticles

IParticle[] MoveParticles(IParticle[] Particles)
Adjusts the particles' axis values based on existing values. Call this method AFTER calling CalculateIteration.

Parameters:
Particles - The particles to move based on their characteristic values.
Returns:
